timeline.bodyText: What's the harm in just initializing the return stack with the proper size always? It would stop us from having to add this extra boolean parameter here.
timeline.author: RatanRSur

replies.bodyText: you're right this makes the code more simple and clean
replies.author: matkt

timeline.bodyText: I see that this is modeled after the existing isValidJumpDestination. What do you think about moving the caching logic for both to the fields themselves using Suppliers.memoize? I think it'd make it easier to read and getting rid of a null in the code makes angels sing :)
timeline.author: RatanRSur

replies.author: matkt

replies.bodyText: I think you're right, this would be too impactful. Looks good as is then :)
replies.author: RatanRSur

timeline.bodyText: Why do we want a 0 capacity return stack as the default?
timeline.author: RatanRSur

replies.bodyText: I just changed with the default size of 1023 as in the EIP
replies.author: matkt

timeline.bodyText: Depending on the discussion with the other comments, we might not need this constructor.
